FuncDef:
The peer advertise destination-origin-as command enables a device to advertise the filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address to a specified peer.
The peer advertise destination-origin-as command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device is not enabled to advertise the filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address to any peer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a BGP peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable a device to advertise the filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address to a specified peer after the device receives a BGP Flow Specification route, run the peer advertise destination-origin-as command. The filtering rule can be used for traffic optimization.
Prerequisites
A BGP Flow Specification peer relationship has been established using the peer as-number command.
